intro: Lithocarpus parvulus, commonly known as the small-leaf stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. Its fruit is a hard, one-seeded nut enclosed in a woody cupule, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. This plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
